In progress. Please help.

Hey, here's a useful page: <nowiki>[[http://radio.linux.org.au/?sectpat=All&ordpat=&descpat=|Linux ham radio application database]]</nowiki>

And here's a list of the ham packages in Raring <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/raring/hamradio/]]</nowiki>

=== Attention users of these packages ===

There is a <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-hams|team established here]]</nowiki> for hams using Ubuntu Linux. This page has more links to the wiki, and to the associated mailing list.

=== Attention developers and debian Packagers ===

There is a <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-hams-devel|team established here]]</nowiki> for ham developers and packagers. This team is subscribed to bugs for all of the Ubuntu packages listed here. The bug volume is low, so there's not a lot of mail. If you are able to help with bugs for these packages, please join the development team.

==== Not Packaged ====

These are amateur radio applications that are not packaged in debian. Many of them have been supplanted by newer, better applications
or have very limited use.

If you are interested having a particular application packaged, please add your name to this table so we can gauge interest.
